00429 
00430 static void gdImageBrushApply(gdImagePtr im, int x, int y);
00431 static void gdImageTileApply(gdImagePtr im, int x, int y);
00432 
00433 gdImagePtr gdImageCreate(int sx, int sy)
00434 {
00435    int i;
00436    gdImagePtr im;
00437    im = (gdImage *) M_MALLOC(sizeof(gdImage));
00438    im->pixels = (unsigned char **) M_MALLOC(sizeof(unsigned char *) * sx);
00439    im->polyInts = 0;
00440    im->polyAllocated = 0;
00441    im->brush = 0;
00442    im->tile = 0;
00443    im->style = 0;
00444    for (i = 0; (i < sx); i++) {
00445       im->pixels[i] = (unsigned char *) M_CALLOC(sy, sizeof(unsigned char));
00446    }
00447    im->sx = sx;
00448    im->sy = sy;
00449    im->colorsTotal = 0;
00450    im->transparent = (-1);
00451    im->interlace = 0;
00452    return im;
00453 }
00454 
00455 void gdImageDestroy(gdImagePtr im)
00456 {
00457    int i;
00458    for (i = 0; (i < im->sx); i++) {
00459       M_FREE(im->pixels[i]);
00460    }
00461    M_FREE(im->pixels);
00462    if (im->polyInts) {
00463       M_FREE(im->polyInts);
00464    }
00465    if (im->style) {
00466       M_FREE(im->style);
00467    }
00468    M_FREE(im);
00469 }
00470 
00471 int gdImageColorClosest(gdImagePtr im, int r, int g, int b)
00472 {
00473    int i;
00474    long rd, gd, bd;
00475    int ct = (-1);
00476    long mindist = 0;
00477    for (i = 0; (i < (im->colorsTotal)); i++) {
00478       long dist;
00479       if (im->open[i]) {
00480          continue;
00481       }
00482       rd = (im->red[i] - r);
00483       gd = (im->green[i] - g);
00484       bd = (im->blue[i] - b);
00485       dist = rd * rd + gd * gd + bd * bd;
00486       if ((i == 0) || (dist < mindist)) {
00487          mindist = dist;
00488          ct = i;
00489       }
00490    }
00491    return ct;
00492 }
00493 
00494 int gdImageColorExact(gdImagePtr im, int r, int g, int b)
00495 {
00496    int i;
00497    for (i = 0; (i < (im->colorsTotal)); i++) {
00498       if (im->open[i]) {
00499          continue;
00500       }
00501       if ((im->red[i] == r) && (im->green[i] == g) && (im->blue[i] == b)) {
00502          return i;
00503       }
00504    }
00505    return -1;
00506 }
00507 
00508 int gdImageColorAllocate(gdImagePtr im, int r, int g, int b)
00509 {
00510    int i;
00511    int ct = (-1);
00512    for (i = 0; (i < (im->colorsTotal)); i++) {
00513       if (im->open[i]) {
00514          ct = i;
00515          break;
00516       }
00517    }
00518    if (ct == (-1)) {
00519       ct = im->colorsTotal;
00520       if (ct == gdMaxColors) {
00521          return -1;
00522       }
00523       im->colorsTotal++;
00524    }
00525    im->red[ct] = r;
00526    im->green[ct] = g;
00527    im->blue[ct] = b;
00528    im->open[ct] = 0;
00529    return ct;
00530 }
00531 
00532 void gdImageColorDeallocate(gdImagePtr im, int color)
00533 {
00534    /* Mark it open. */
00535    im->open[color] = 1;
00536 }
00537 
00538 void gdImageColorTransparent(gdImagePtr im, int color)
00539 {
00540    im->transparent = color;
00541 }
00542 
00543 void gdImageSetPixel(gdImagePtr im, int x, int y, int color)
00544 {
00545    int p;
00546    switch (color) {
00547    case gdStyled:
00548       if (!im->style) {
00549          /* Refuse to draw if no style is set. */
00550          return;
00551       } else {
00552          p = im->style[im->stylePos++];
00553       }
00554       if (p != (gdTransparent)) {
00555          gdImageSetPixel(im, x, y, p);
00556       }
00557       im->stylePos = im->stylePos % im->styleLength;
00558       break;
00559    case gdStyledBrushed:
00560       if (!im->style) {
00561          /* Refuse to draw if no style is set. */
00562          return;
00563       }
00564       p = im->style[im->stylePos++];
00565       if ((p != gdTransparent) && (p != 0)) {
00566          gdImageSetPixel(im, x, y, gdBrushed);
00567       }
00568       im->stylePos = im->stylePos % im->styleLength;
00569       break;
00570    case gdBrushed:
00571       gdImageBrushApply(im, x, y);
00572       break;
00573    case gdTiled:
00574       gdImageTileApply(im, x, y);
00575       break;
00576    default:
00577       if (gdImageBoundsSafe(im, x, y)) {
00578          im->pixels[x][y] = color;
00579       }
00580       break;
00581    }
00582 }
00583 
00584 static void gdImageBrushApply(gdImagePtr im, int x, int y)
00585 {
00586    int lx, ly;
00587    int hy;
00588    int hx;
00589    int x1, y1, x2, y2;
00590    int srcx, srcy;
00591    if (!im->brush) {
00592       return;
00593    }
00594    hy = gdImageSY(im->brush) / 2;
00595    y1 = y - hy;
00596    y2 = y1 + gdImageSY(im->brush);
00597    hx = gdImageSX(im->brush) / 2;
00598    x1 = x - hx;
00599    x2 = x1 + gdImageSX(im->brush);
00600    srcy = 0;
00601    for (ly = y1; (ly < y2); ly++) {
00602       srcx = 0;
00603       for (lx = x1; (lx < x2); lx++) {
00604          int p;
00605          p = gdImageGetPixel(im->brush, srcx, srcy);
00606          /* Allow for non-square brushes! */
00607          if (p != gdImageGetTransparent(im->brush)) {
00608             gdImageSetPixel(im, lx, ly, im->brushColorMap[p]);
00609          }
00610          srcx++;
00611       }
00612       srcy++;
00613    }
00614 }
00615 
00616 static void gdImageTileApply(gdImagePtr im, int x, int y)
00617 {
00618    int srcx, srcy;
00619    int p;
00620    if (!im->tile) {
00621       return;
00622    }
00623    srcx = x % gdImageSX(im->tile);
00624    srcy = y % gdImageSY(im->tile);
00625    p = gdImageGetPixel(im->tile, srcx, srcy);
00626    /* Allow for transparency */
00627    if (p != gdImageGetTransparent(im->tile)) {
00628       gdImageSetPixel(im, x, y, im->tileColorMap[p]);
00629    }
00630 }
00631 
00632 int gdImageGetPixel(gdImagePtr im, int x, int y)
00633 {
00634    if (gdImageBoundsSafe(im, x, y)) {
00635       return im->pixels[x][y];
00636    } else {
00637       return 0;
00638    }
00639 }
00640 
00641 /* Bresenham as presented in Foley & Van Dam */
00642 
00643 void gdImageLine(gdImagePtr im, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, int color)
00644 {
00645    int dx, dy, incr1, incr2, d, x, y, xend, yend, xdirflag, ydirflag;
00646    dx = abs(x2 - x1);
00647    dy = abs(y2 - y1);
00648    if (dy <= dx) {
00649       d = 2 * dy - dx;
00650       incr1 = 2 * dy;
00651       incr2 = 2 * (dy - dx);
00652       if (x1 > x2) {
00653          x = x2;
00654          y = y2;
00655          ydirflag = (-1);
00656          xend = x1;
00657       } else {
00658          x = x1;
00659          y = y1;
00660          ydirflag = 1;
00661          xend = x2;
00662       }
00663       gdImageSetPixel(im, x, y, color);
00664       if (((y2 - y1) * ydirflag) > 0) {
00665          while (x < xend) {
00666             x++;
00667             if (d < 0) {
00668                d += incr1;
00669             } else {
00670                y++;
00671                d += incr2;
00672             }
00673             gdImageSetPixel(im, x, y, color);
00674          }
00675       } else {
00676          while (x < xend) {
00677             x++;
00678             if (d < 0) {
00679                d += incr1;
00680             } else {
00681                y--;
00682                d += incr2;
00683             }
00684             gdImageSetPixel(im, x, y, color);
00685          }
00686       }
00687    } else {
00688       d = 2 * dx - dy;
00689       incr1 = 2 * dx;
00690       incr2 = 2 * (dx - dy);
00691       if (y1 > y2) {
00692          y = y2;
00693          x = x2;
00694          yend = y1;
00695          xdirflag = (-1);
00696       } else {
00697          y = y1;
00698          x = x1;
00699          yend = y2;
00700          xdirflag = 1;
00701       }
00702       gdImageSetPixel(im, x, y, color);
00703       if (((x2 - x1) * xdirflag) > 0) {
00704          while (y < yend) {
00705             y++;
00706             if (d < 0) {
00707                d += incr1;
00708             } else {
00709                x++;
00710                d += incr2;
00711             }
00712             gdImageSetPixel(im, x, y, color);
00713          }
00714       } else {
00715          while (y < yend) {
00716             y++;
00717             if (d < 0) {
00718                d += incr1;
00719             } else {
00720                x--;
00721                d += incr2;
00722             }
00723             gdImageSetPixel(im, x, y, color);
00724          }
00725       }
00726    }
00727 }
00728 
00729 /* As above, plus dashing */
00730 
00731 #define dashedSet \
00732         { \
00733                 dashStep++; \
00734                 if (dashStep == gdDashSize) { \
00735                         dashStep = 0; \
00736                         on = !on; \
00737                 } \
00738                 if (on) { \
00739                         gdImageSetPixel(im, x, y, color); \
00740                 } \
00741         }
00742 
00743 void gdImageDashedLine(gdImagePtr im, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, int color)
00744 {
00745    int dx, dy, incr1, incr2, d, x, y, xend, yend, xdirflag, ydirflag;
00746    int dashStep = 0;
00747    int on = 1;
00748    dx = abs(x2 - x1);
00749    dy = abs(y2 - y1);
00750    if (dy <= dx) {
00751       d = 2 * dy - dx;
00752       incr1 = 2 * dy;
00753       incr2 = 2 * (dy - dx);
00754       if (x1 > x2) {
00755          x = x2;
00756          y = y2;
00757          ydirflag = (-1);
00758          xend = x1;
00759       } else {
00760          x = x1;
00761          y = y1;
00762          ydirflag = 1;
00763          xend = x2;
00764       }
00765       dashedSet;
00766       if (((y2 - y1) * ydirflag) > 0) {
00767          while (x < xend) {
00768             x++;
00769             if (d < 0) {
00770                d += incr1;
00771             } else {
00772                y++;
00773                d += incr2;
00774             }
00775             dashedSet;
00776          }
00777       } else {
00778          while (x < xend) {
00779             x++;
00780             if (d < 0) {
00781                d += incr1;
00782             } else {
00783                y--;
00784                d += incr2;
00785             }
00786             dashedSet;
00787          }
00788       }
00789    } else {
00790       d = 2 * dx - dy;
00791       incr1 = 2 * dx;
00792       incr2 = 2 * (dx - dy);
00793       if (y1 > y2) {
00794          y = y2;
00795          x = x2;
00796          yend = y1;
00797          xdirflag = (-1);
00798       } else {
00799          y = y1;
00800          x = x1;
00801          yend = y2;
00802          xdirflag = 1;
00803       }
00804       dashedSet;
00805       if (((x2 - x1) * xdirflag) > 0) {
00806          while (y < yend) {
00807             y++;
00808             if (d < 0) {
00809                d += incr1;
00810             } else {
00811                x++;
00812                d += incr2;
00813             }
00814             dashedSet;
00815          }
00816       } else {
00817          while (y < yend) {
00818             y++;
00819             if (d < 0) {
00820                d += incr1;
00821             } else {
00822                x--;
00823                d += incr2;
00824             }
00825             dashedSet;
00826          }
00827       }
00828    }
00829 }
00830 
00831 int gdImageBoundsSafe(gdImagePtr im, int x, int y)
00832 {
00833    return (!(((y < 0) || (y >= im->sy)) || ((x < 0) || (x >= im->sx))));
00834 }
00835 
00836 void gdImageChar(gdImagePtr im, gdFontPtr f, int x, int y, int c, int color)
00837 {
00838    int cx, cy;
00839    int px, py;
00840    int fline;
00841    cx = 0;
00842    cy = 0;
00843    if ((c < f->offset) || (c >= (f->offset + f->nchars))) {
00844       return;
00845    }
00846    fline = (c - f->offset) * f->h;
00847    for (py = y; (py < (y + f->h)); py++) {
00848       for (px = x; (px < (x + f->w)); px++) {
00849          if (f->data[fline + cy] & (1 << cx)) {
00850             gdImageSetPixel(im, px, py, color);
00851          }
00852          cx++;
00853       }
00854       cx = 0;
00855       cy++;
00856    }
00857 }
00858 
00859 void gdImageCharUp(gdImagePtr im, gdFontPtr f, int x, int y, char c, int color)
00860 {
00861    int cx, cy;
00862    int px, py;
00863    int fline;
00864    cx = 0;
00865    cy = 0;
00866    if ((c < f->offset) || (c >= (f->offset + f->nchars))) {
00867       return;
00868    }
00869    fline = (c - f->offset) * f->h;
00870    for (py = y; (py > (y - f->w)); py--) {
00871       for (px = x; (px < (x + f->h)); px++) {
00872          if (f->data[fline + cy] & (1 << cx)) {
00873             gdImageSetPixel(im, px, py, color);
00874          }
00875          cy++;
00876       }
00877       cy = 0;
00878       cx++;
00879    }
00880 }
00881 
00882 void gdImageString(gdImagePtr im, gdFontPtr f, int x, int y, char *s, int color)
00883 {
00884    int i;
00885    int l;
00886    l = strlen(s);
00887    for (i = 0; (i < l); i++) {
00888       gdImageChar(im, f, x, y, s[i], color);
00889       x += f->w;
00890    }
00891 }
00892 
00893 void gdImageStringUp(gdImagePtr im, gdFontPtr f, int x, int y, char *s, int color)
00894 {
00895    int i;
00896    int l;
00897    l = strlen(s);
00898    for (i = 0; (i < l); i++) {
00899       gdImageCharUp(im, f, x, y, s[i], color);
00900       y -= f->w;
00901    }
00902 }
00903 
00904 void gdImageFillToBorder(gdImagePtr im, int x, int y, int border, int color)
00905 {
00906    int lastBorder;
00907    /* Seek left */
00908    int leftLimit, rightLimit;
00909    int i;
00910    leftLimit = (-1);
00911    if (border < 0) {
00912       /* Refuse to fill to a non-solid border */
00913       return;
00914    }
00915    for (i = x; (i >= 0); i--) {
00916       if (gdImageGetPixel(im, i, y) == border) {
00917          break;
00918       }
00919       gdImageSetPixel(im, i, y, color);
00920       leftLimit = i;
00921    }
00922    if (leftLimit == (-1)) {
00923       return;
00924    }
00925    /* Seek right */
00926    rightLimit = x;
00927    for (i = (x + 1); (i < im->sx); i++) {
00928       if (gdImageGetPixel(im, i, y) == border) {
00929          break;
00930       }
00931       gdImageSetPixel(im, i, y, color);
00932       rightLimit = i;
00933    }
00934    /* Look at lines above and below and start paints */
00935    /* Above */
00936    if (y > 0) {
00937       lastBorder = 1;
00938       for (i = leftLimit; (i <= rightLimit); i++) {
00939          int c;
00940          c = gdImageGetPixel(im, i, y - 1);
00941          if (lastBorder) {
00942             if ((c != border) && (c != color)) {
00943                gdImageFillToBorder(im, i, y - 1, border, color);
00944                lastBorder = 0;
00945             }
00946          } else if ((c == border) || (c == color)) {
00947             lastBorder = 1;
00948          }
00949       }
00950    }
00951    /* Below */
00952    if (y < ((im->sy) - 1)) {
00953       lastBorder = 1;
00954       for (i = leftLimit; (i <= rightLimit); i++) {
00955          int c;
00956          c = gdImageGetPixel(im, i, y + 1);
00957          if (lastBorder) {
00958             if ((c != border) && (c != color)) {
00959                gdImageFillToBorder(im, i, y + 1, border, color);
00960                lastBorder = 0;
00961             }
00962          } else if ((c == border) || (c == color)) {
00963             lastBorder = 1;
00964          }
00965       }
00966    }
00967 }
00968 
00969 void gdImageFill(gdImagePtr im, int x, int y, int color)
00970 {
00971    int lastBorder;
00972    int old;
00973    int leftLimit, rightLimit;
00974    int i;
00975    old = gdImageGetPixel(im, x, y);
00976    if (color == gdTiled) {
00977       /* Tile fill -- got to watch out! */
00978       int p, tileColor;
00979       int srcx, srcy;
00980       if (!im->tile) {
00981          return;
00982       }
00983       /* Refuse to flood-fill with a transparent pattern --
00984          I can't do it without allocating another image */
00985       if (gdImageGetTransparent(im->tile) != (-1)) {
00986          return;
00987       }
00988       srcx = x % gdImageSX(im->tile);
00989       srcy = y % gdImageSY(im->tile);
00990       p = gdImageGetPixel(im->tile, srcx, srcy);
00991       tileColor = im->tileColorMap[p];
00992       if (old == tileColor) {
00993          /* Nothing to be done */
00994          return;
00995       }
00996    } else {
00997       if (old == color) {
00998          /* Nothing to be done */
00999          return;
01000       }
01001    }
01002    /* Seek left */
01003    leftLimit = (-1);
01004    for (i = x; (i >= 0); i--) {
01005       if (gdImageGetPixel(im, i, y) != old) {
01006          break;
01007       }
01008       gdImageSetPixel(im, i, y, color);
01009       leftLimit = i;
01010    }
01011    if (leftLimit == (-1)) {
01012       return;
01013    }
01014    /* Seek right */
01015    rightLimit = x;
01016    for (i = (x + 1); (i < im->sx); i++) {
01017       if (gdImageGetPixel(im, i, y) != old) {
01018          break;
01019       }
01020       gdImageSetPixel(im, i, y, color);
01021       rightLimit = i;
01022    }
01023    /* Look at lines above and below and start paints */
01024    /* Above */
01025    if (y > 0) {
01026       lastBorder = 1;
01027       for (i = leftLimit; (i <= rightLimit); i++) {
01028          int c;
01029          c = gdImageGetPixel(im, i, y - 1);
01030          if (lastBorder) {
01031             if (c == old) {
01032                gdImageFill(im, i, y - 1, color);
01033                lastBorder = 0;
01034             }
01035          } else if (c != old) {
01036             lastBorder = 1;
01037          }
01038       }
01039    }
01040    /* Below */
01041    if (y < ((im->sy) - 1)) {
01042       lastBorder = 1;
01043       for (i = leftLimit; (i <= rightLimit); i++) {
01044          int c;
01045          c = gdImageGetPixel(im, i, y + 1);
01046          if (lastBorder) {
01047             if (c == old) {
01048                gdImageFill(im, i, y + 1, color);
01049                lastBorder = 0;
01050             }
01051          } else if (c != old) {
01052             lastBorder = 1;
01053          }
01054       }
01055    }
01056 }
01057 
01058 #ifdef TEST_CODE
01059 void gdImageDump(gdImagePtr im)
01060 {
01061    int i, j;
01062    for (i = 0; (i < im->sy); i++) {
01063       for (j = 0; (j < im->sx); j++) {
01064          printf("%d", im->pixels[j][i]);
01065       }
01066       printf("\n");
01067    }
01068 }
01069 #endif

01071 /* Code drawn from ppmtogif.c, from the pbmplus package
01072 **
01073 ** Based on GIFENCOD by David Rowley <mgardi@watdscu.waterloo.edu>. A
01074 ** Lempel-Zim compression based on "compress".
01075 **
01076 ** Modified by Marcel Wijkstra <wijkstra@fwi.uva.nl>
01077 **
01078 ** Copyright (C) 1989 by Jef Poskanzer.
01079 **
01080 ** Permission to use, copy, modify, and distribute this software and its
01081 ** documentation for any purpose and without fee is hereby granted, provided
01082 ** that the above copyright notice appear in all copies and that both that
01083 ** copyright notice and this permission notice appear in supporting
01084 ** documentation.  This software is provided "as is" without express or
01085 ** implied warranty.
01086 **
01087 ** The Graphics Interchange Format(c) is the Copyright property of
01088 ** CompuServe Incorporated.  GIF(sm) is a Service Mark property of
01089 ** CompuServe Incorporated.

01092 /*
01093  * a code_int must be able to hold 2**GIFBITS values of type int, and also -1
01094  */
01095 typedef int code_int;
01096 
01097 #ifdef SIGNED_COMPARE_SLOW
01098 typedef unsigned long int count_int;
01099 typedef unsigned short int count_short;
01100 #else                           /*SIGNED_COMPARE_SLOW */
01101 typedef long int count_int;
01102 #endif                          /*SIGNED_COMPARE_SLOW */
01103 
01104 static int colorstobpp(int colors);
01105 static void BumpPixel(void);
01106 static int GIFNextPixel(gdImagePtr im);
01107 static void GIFEncode(gdGifBuffer * buffer, int GWidth, int GHeight, int GInterlace,
01108                       int Background, int Transparent, int BitsPerPixel, int *Red,
01109                       int *Green, int *Blue, gdImagePtr im);
01110 static void Putword(int w, gdGifBuffer * buffer);
01111 static void compress(int init_bits, gdGifBuffer * buffer, gdImagePtr im);
01112 static void output(code_int code);
01113 static void cl_block(void);
01114 static void cl_hash(register count_int hsize);
01115 static void char_init(void);
01116 static void char_out(int c);
01117 static void flush_char(void);
01118 /* Allows for reuse */
01119 static void init_statics(void);
01120 
01121 char gif_buffer[500000];
01122 
01123 void gdImageGif(gdImagePtr im, gdGifBuffer * buffer)
01124 {
01125    int interlace, transparent, BitsPerPixel;
01126    interlace = im->interlace;
01127    transparent = im->transparent;
01128 
01129    /* allocate buffer */
01130    buffer->size = 0;
01131    buffer->data = gif_buffer;
01132 
01133    BitsPerPixel = colorstobpp(im->colorsTotal);
01134    /* Clear any old values in statics strewn through the GIF code */
01135    init_statics();
01136    /* All set, let's do it. */
01137    GIFEncode(buffer, im->sx, im->sy, interlace, 0, transparent, BitsPerPixel,
01138              im->red, im->green, im->blue, im);
01139 }
01140 
01141 static int colorstobpp(int colors)
01142 {
01143    int bpp = 0;
01144 
01145    if (colors <= 2)
01146       bpp = 1;
01147    else if (colors <= 4)
01148       bpp = 2;
01149    else if (colors <= 8)
01150       bpp = 3;
01151    else if (colors <= 16)
01152       bpp = 4;
01153    else if (colors <= 32)
01154       bpp = 5;
01155    else if (colors <= 64)
01156       bpp = 6;
01157    else if (colors <= 128)
01158       bpp = 7;
01159    else if (colors <= 256)
01160       bpp = 8;
01161    return bpp;
01162 }
01163 
01164 /*****************************************************************************
01165  *
01166  * GIFENCODE.C    - GIF Image compression interface
01167  *
01168  * GIFEncode( FName, GHeight, GWidth, GInterlace, Background, Transparent,
01169  *            BitsPerPixel, Red, Green, Blue, gdImagePtr )
01170  *
01171  *****************************************************************************/
01172 
01173 #define TRUE 1
01174 #define FALSE 0
01175 
01176 static int Width, Height;
01177 static int curx, cury;
01178 static long CountDown;
01179 static int Pass = 0;
01180 static int Interlace;
01181 
01182 /*
01183  * Bump the 'curx' and 'cury' to point to the next pixel
01184  */
01185 static void BumpPixel(void)
01186 {
01187    /*
01188     * Bump the current X position
01189     */
01190    ++curx;
01191 
01192    /*
01193     * If we are at the end of a scan line, set curx back to the beginning
01194     * If we are interlaced, bump the cury to the appropriate spot,
01195     * otherwise, just increment it.
01196     */
01197    if (curx == Width) {
01198       curx = 0;
01199 
01200       if (!Interlace)
01201          ++cury;
01202       else {
01203          switch (Pass) {
01204 
01205          case 0:
01206             cury += 8;
01207             if (cury >= Height) {
01208                ++Pass;
01209                cury = 4;
01210             }
01211             break;
01212 
01213          case 1:
01214             cury += 8;
01215             if (cury >= Height) {
01216                ++Pass;
01217                cury = 2;
01218             }
01219             break;
01220 
01221          case 2:
01222             cury += 4;
01223             if (cury >= Height) {
01224                ++Pass;
01225                cury = 1;
01226             }
01227             break;
01228 
01229          case 3:
01230             cury += 2;
01231             break;
01232          }
01233       }
01234    }
01235 }
01236 
01237 /*
01238  * Return the next pixel from the image
01239  */
01240 static int GIFNextPixel(gdImagePtr im)
01241 {
01242    int r;
01243 
01244    if (CountDown == 0)
01245       return EOF;
01246 
01247    --CountDown;
01248 
01249    r = gdImageGetPixel(im, curx, cury);
01250 
01251    BumpPixel();
01252 
01253    return r;
01254 }
01255 
01256 /* public */
01257 
01258 void bputc(int c, gdGifBuffer * buffer)
01259 {
01260    buffer->data[buffer->size++] = (unsigned char) c;
01261 }
01262 
01263 static void
01264 GIFEncode(gdGifBuffer * buffer, int GWidth, int GHeight, int GInterlace, int Background,
01265           int Transparent, int BitsPerPixel, int *Red, int *Green, int *Blue,
01266           gdImagePtr im)
01267 {
01268    int B;
01269    int RWidth, RHeight;
01270    int LeftOfs, TopOfs;
01271    int Resolution;
01272    int ColorMapSize;
01273    int InitCodeSize;
01274    int i;
01275 
01276    Interlace = GInterlace;
01277 
01278    ColorMapSize = 1 << BitsPerPixel;
01279 
01280    RWidth = Width = GWidth;
01281    RHeight = Height = GHeight;
01282    LeftOfs = TopOfs = 0;
01283 
01284    Resolution = BitsPerPixel;
01285 
01286    /*
01287     * Calculate number of bits we are expecting
01288     */
01289    CountDown = (long) Width *(long) Height;
01290 
01291    /*
01292     * Indicate which pass we are on (if interlace)
01293     */
01294    Pass = 0;
01295 
01296    /*
01297     * The initial code size
01298     */
01299    if (BitsPerPixel <= 1)
01300       InitCodeSize = 2;
01301    else
01302       InitCodeSize = BitsPerPixel;
01303 
01304    /*
01305     * Set up the current x and y position
01306     */
01307    curx = cury = 0;
01308 
01309    /*
01310     * Write the Magic header
01311     */
01312    memcpy(buffer->data + buffer->size, Transparent < 0 ? "GIF87a" : "GIF89a", 6);
01313    buffer->size += 6;
01314 
01315    /*
01316     * Write out the screen width and height
01317     */
01318    Putword(RWidth, buffer);
01319    Putword(RHeight, buffer);
01320 
01321    /*
01322     * Indicate that there is a global colour map
01323     */
01324    B = 0x80;                    /* Yes, there is a color map */
01325 
01326    /*
01327     * OR in the resolution
01328     */
01329    B |= (Resolution - 1) << 5;
01330 
01331    /*
01332     * OR in the Bits per Pixel
01333     */
01334    B |= (BitsPerPixel - 1);
01335 
01336    /*
01337     * Write it out
01338     */
01339    bputc(B, buffer);
01340 
01341    /*
01342     * Write out the Background colour
01343     */
01344    bputc(Background, buffer);
01345 
01346    /*
01347     * Byte of 0's (future expansion)
01348     */
01349    bputc(0, buffer);
01350 
01351    /*
01352     * Write out the Global Colour Map
01353     */
01354    for (i = 0; i < ColorMapSize; ++i) {
01355       bputc(Red[i], buffer);
01356       bputc(Green[i], buffer);
01357       bputc(Blue[i], buffer);
01358    }
01359 
01360    /*
01361     * Write out extension for transparent colour index, if necessary.
01362     */
01363    if (Transparent >= 0) {
01364       bputc('!', buffer);
01365       bputc(0xf9, buffer);
01366       bputc(4, buffer);
01367       bputc(1, buffer);
01368       bputc(0, buffer);
01369       bputc(0, buffer);
01370       bputc((unsigned char) Transparent, buffer);
01371       bputc(0, buffer);
01372    }
01373 
01374    /*
01375     * Write an Image separator
01376     */
01377    bputc(',', buffer);
01378 
01379    /*
01380     * Write the Image header
01381     */
01382 
01383    Putword(LeftOfs, buffer);
01384    Putword(TopOfs, buffer);
01385    Putword(Width, buffer);
01386    Putword(Height, buffer);
01387 
01388    /*
01389     * Write out whether or not the image is interlaced
01390     */
01391    if (Interlace)
01392       bputc(0x40, buffer);
01393    else
01394       bputc(0x00, buffer);
01395 
01396    /*
01397     * Write out the initial code size
01398     */
01399    bputc(InitCodeSize, buffer);
01400 
01401    /*
01402     * Go and actually compress the data
01403     */
01404    compress(InitCodeSize + 1, buffer, im);
01405 
01406    /*
01407     * Write out a Zero-length packet (to end the series)
01408     */
01409    bputc(0, buffer);
01410 
01411    /*
01412     * Write the GIF file terminator
01413     */
01414    bputc(';', buffer);
01415 }
01416 
01417 /*
01418  * Write out a word to the GIF file
01419  */
01420 static void Putword(int w, gdGifBuffer * buffer)
01421 {
01422    buffer->data[buffer->size++] = (unsigned char) (w & 0xff);
01423    buffer->data[buffer->size++] = (unsigned char) ((w / 256) & 0xff);
01424 }
01425 
01426 
01427 /***************************************************************************
01428  *
01429  *  GIFCOMPR.C       - GIF Image compression routines
01430  *
01431  *  Lempel-Ziv compression based on 'compress'.  GIF modifications by
01432  *  David Rowley (mgardi@watdcsu.waterloo.edu)
01433  *
01434  ***************************************************************************/
01435 
01436 /*
01437  * General DEFINEs
01438  */
01439 
01440 #define GIFBITS    12
01441 
01442 #define HSIZE  5003             /* 80% occupancy */
01443 
01444 #ifdef NO_UCHAR
01445 typedef char char_type;
01446 #else                           /*NO_UCHAR */
01447 typedef unsigned char char_type;
01448 #endif                          /*NO_UCHAR */
01449 
01450 /*
01451  *
01452  * GIF Image compression - modified 'compress'
01453  *
01454  * Based on: compress.c - File compression ala IEEE Computer, June 1984.
01455  *
01456  * By Authors:  Spencer W. Thomas       (decvax!harpo!utah-cs!utah-gr!thomas)
01457  *              Jim McKie               (decvax!mcvax!jim)
01458  *              Steve Davies            (decvax!vax135!petsd!peora!srd)
01459  *              Ken Turkowski           (decvax!decwrl!turtlevax!ken)
01460  *              James A. Woods          (decvax!ihnp4!ames!jaw)
01461  *              Joe Orost               (decvax!vax135!petsd!joe)
01462  *
01463  */
01464 #include <ctype.h>
01465 
01466 #define ARGVAL() (*++(*argv) || (--argc && *++argv))
01467 
01468 static int n_bits;              /* number of bits/code */
01469 static int maxbits = GIFBITS;   /* user settable max # bits/code */
01470 static code_int maxcode;        /* maximum code, given n_bits */
01471 static code_int maxmaxcode = (code_int) 1 << GIFBITS;   /* should NEVER generate this code */
01472 #ifdef COMPATIBLE               /* But wrong! */
01473 # define MAXCODE(n_bits)        ((code_int) 1 << (n_bits) - 1)
01474 #else /*COMPATIBLE*/
01475 # define MAXCODE(n_bits)        (((code_int) 1 << (n_bits)) - 1)
01476 #endif /*COMPATIBLE*/
01477 static count_int htab[HSIZE];
01478 static unsigned short codetab[HSIZE];
01479 #define HashTabOf(i)       htab[i]
01480 #define CodeTabOf(i)    codetab[i]
01481 
01482 static code_int hsize = HSIZE;  /* for dynamic table sizing */
01483 
01484 /*
01485  * To save much memory, we overlay the table used by compress() with those
01486  * used by decompress().  The tab_prefix table is the same size and type
01487  * as the codetab.  The tab_suffix table needs 2**GIFBITS characters.  We
01488  * get this from the beginning of htab.  The output stack uses the rest
01489  * of htab, and contains characters.  There is plenty of room for any
01490  * possible stack (stack used to be 8000 characters).
01491  */
01492 
01493 #define tab_prefixof(i) CodeTabOf(i)
01494 #define tab_suffixof(i)        ((char_type*)(htab))[i]
01495 #define de_stack               ((char_type*)&tab_suffixof((code_int)1<<GIFBITS))
01496 
01497 static code_int free_ent = 0;   /* first unused entry */
01498 
01499 /*
01500  * block compression parameters -- after all codes are used up,
01501  * and compression rate changes, start over.
01502  */
01503 static int clear_flg = 0;
01504 
01505 static int offset;
01506 static long int in_count = 1;   /* length of input */
01507 static long int out_count = 0;  /* # of codes output (for debugging) */
01508 
01509 /*
01510  * compress stdin to stdout
01511  *
01512  * Algorithm:  use open addressing double hashing (no chaining) on the
01513  * prefix code / next character combination.  We do a variant of Knuth's
01514  * algorithm D (vol. 3, sec. 6.4) along with G. Knott's relatively-prime
01515  * secondary probe.  Here, the modular division first probe is gives way
01516  * to a faster exclusive-or manipulation.  Also do block compression with
01517  * an adaptive reset, whereby the code table is cleared when the compression
01518  * ratio decreases, but after the table fills.  The variable-length output
01519  * codes are re-sized at this point, and a special CLEAR code is generated
01520  * for the decompressor.  Late addition:  construct the table according to
01521  * file size for noticeable speed improvement on small files.  Please direct
01522  * questions about this implementation to ames!jaw.
01523  */
01524 
01525 static int g_init_bits;
01526 static gdGifBuffer *g_outbuffer;
01527 
01528 static int ClearCode;
01529 static int EOFCode;
01530 
01531 static void compress(int init_bits, gdGifBuffer * buffer, gdImagePtr im)
01532 {
01533    register long fcode;
01534    register code_int i /* = 0 */ ;
01535    register int c;
01536    register code_int ent;
01537    register code_int disp;
01538    register code_int hsize_reg;
01539    register int hshift;
01540 
01541    /*
01542     * Set up the globals:  g_init_bits - initial number of bits
01543     *                      g_outbuffer   - pointer to output file
01544     */
01545    g_init_bits = init_bits;
01546    g_outbuffer = buffer;
01547 
01548    /*
01549     * Set up the necessary values
01550     */
01551    offset = 0;
01552    out_count = 0;
01553    clear_flg = 0;
01554    in_count = 1;
01555    maxcode = MAXCODE(n_bits = g_init_bits);
01556 
01557    ClearCode = (1 << (init_bits - 1));
01558    EOFCode = ClearCode + 1;
01559    free_ent = ClearCode + 2;
01560 
01561    char_init();
01562 
01563    ent = GIFNextPixel(im);
01564 
01565    hshift = 0;
01566    for (fcode = (long) hsize; fcode < 65536L; fcode *= 2L)
01567       ++hshift;
01568    hshift = 8 - hshift;         /* set hash code range bound */
01569 
01570    hsize_reg = hsize;
01571    cl_hash((count_int) hsize_reg);      /* clear hash table */
01572 
01573    output((code_int) ClearCode);
01574 
01575 #ifdef SIGNED_COMPARE_SLOW
01576    while ((c = GIFNextPixel(im)) != (unsigned) EOF) {
01577 #else                           /*SIGNED_COMPARE_SLOW */
01578    while ((c = GIFNextPixel(im)) != EOF) {      /* } */
01579 #endif                          /*SIGNED_COMPARE_SLOW */
01580 
01581       ++in_count;
01582 
01583       fcode = (long) (((long) c << maxbits) + ent);
01584       i = (((code_int) c << hshift) ^ ent);     /* xor hashing */
01585 
01586       if (HashTabOf(i) == fcode) {
01587          ent = CodeTabOf(i);
01588          continue;
01589       } else if ((long) HashTabOf(i) < 0)       /* empty slot */
01590          goto nomatch;
01591       disp = hsize_reg - i;     /* secondary hash (after G. Knott) */
01592       if (i == 0)
01593          disp = 1;
01594     probe:
01595       if ((i -= disp) < 0)
01596          i += hsize_reg;
01597 
01598       if (HashTabOf(i) == fcode) {
01599          ent = CodeTabOf(i);
01600          continue;
01601       }
01602       if ((long) HashTabOf(i) > 0)
01603          goto probe;
01604     nomatch:
01605       output((code_int) ent);
01606       ++out_count;
01607       ent = c;
01608 #ifdef SIGNED_COMPARE_SLOW
01609       if ((unsigned) free_ent < (unsigned) maxmaxcode) {
01610 #else                           /*SIGNED_COMPARE_SLOW */
01611       if (free_ent < maxmaxcode) {      /* } */
01612 #endif                          /*SIGNED_COMPARE_SLOW */
01613          CodeTabOf(i) = free_ent++;     /* code -> hashtable */
01614          HashTabOf(i) = fcode;
01615       } else
01616          cl_block();
01617    }
01618    /*
01619     * Put out the final code.
01620     */
01621    output((code_int) ent);
01622    ++out_count;
01623    output((code_int) EOFCode);
01624 }
01625 
01626 /*****************************************************************
01627  * TAG( output )
01628  *
01629  * Output the given code.
01630  * Inputs:
01631  *      code:   A n_bits-bit integer.  If == -1, then EOF.  This assumes
01632  *              that n_bits =< (long)wordsize - 1.
01633  * Outputs:
01634  *      Outputs code to the file.
01635  * Assumptions:
01636  *      Chars are 8 bits long.
01637  * Algorithm:
01638  *      Maintain a GIFBITS character long buffer (so that 8 codes will
01639  * fit in it exactly).  Use the VAX insv instruction to insert each
01640  * code in turn.  When the buffer fills up empty it and start over.
01641  */
01642 
01643 static unsigned long cur_accum = 0;
01644 static int cur_bits = 0;
01645 
01646 static unsigned long masks[] = { 0x0000, 0x0001, 0x0003, 0x0007, 0x000F,
01647    0x001F, 0x003F, 0x007F, 0x00FF,
01648    0x01FF, 0x03FF, 0x07FF, 0x0FFF,
01649    0x1FFF, 0x3FFF, 0x7FFF, 0xFFFF
01650 };
01651 
01652 static void output(code_int code)
01653 {
01654    cur_accum &= masks[cur_bits];
01655 
01656    if (cur_bits > 0)
01657       cur_accum |= ((long) code << cur_bits);
01658    else
01659       cur_accum = code;
01660 
01661    cur_bits += n_bits;
01662 
01663    while (cur_bits >= 8) {
01664       char_out((unsigned int) (cur_accum & 0xff));
01665       cur_accum >>= 8;
01666       cur_bits -= 8;
01667    }
01668 
01669    /*
01670     * If the next entry is going to be too big for the code size,
01671     * then increase it, if possible.
01672     */
01673    if (free_ent > maxcode || clear_flg) {
01674 
01675       if (clear_flg) {
01676 
01677          maxcode = MAXCODE(n_bits = g_init_bits);
01678          clear_flg = 0;
01679 
01680       } else {
01681 
01682          ++n_bits;
01683          if (n_bits == maxbits)
01684             maxcode = maxmaxcode;
01685          else
01686             maxcode = MAXCODE(n_bits);
01687       }
01688    }
01689 
01690    if (code == EOFCode) {
01691       /*
01692        * At EOF, write the rest of the buffer.
01693        */
01694       while (cur_bits > 0) {
01695          char_out((unsigned int) (cur_accum & 0xff));
01696          cur_accum >>= 8;
01697          cur_bits -= 8;
01698       }
01699 
01700       flush_char();
01701 
01702    }
01703 }
01704 
01705 /*
01706  * Clear out the hash table
01707  */
01708 static void cl_block(void)
01709 {                               /* table clear for block compress */
01710 
01711    cl_hash((count_int) hsize);
01712    free_ent = ClearCode + 2;
01713    clear_flg = 1;
01714 
01715    output((code_int) ClearCode);
01716 }
01717 
01718 static void cl_hash(register count_int hsize)
01719 {                               /* reset code table */
01720 
01721    register count_int *htab_p = htab + hsize;
01722 
01723    register long i;
01724    register long m1 = -1;
01725 
01726    i = hsize - 16;
01727    do {                         /* might use Sys V memset(3) here */
01728       *(htab_p - 16) = m1;
01729       *(htab_p - 15) = m1;
01730       *(htab_p - 14) = m1;
01731       *(htab_p - 13) = m1;
01732       *(htab_p - 12) = m1;
01733       *(htab_p - 11) = m1;
01734       *(htab_p - 10) = m1;
01735       *(htab_p - 9) = m1;
01736       *(htab_p - 8) = m1;
01737       *(htab_p - 7) = m1;
01738       *(htab_p - 6) = m1;
01739       *(htab_p - 5) = m1;
01740       *(htab_p - 4) = m1;
01741       *(htab_p - 3) = m1;
01742       *(htab_p - 2) = m1;
01743       *(htab_p - 1) = m1;
01744       htab_p -= 16;
01745    } while ((i -= 16) >= 0);
01746 
01747    for (i += 16; i > 0; --i)
01748       *--htab_p = m1;
01749 }
01750 
01751 /******************************************************************************
01752  *
01753  * GIF Specific routines
01754  *
01755  ******************************************************************************/
01756 
01757 /*
01758  * Number of characters so far in this 'packet'
01759  */
01760 static int a_count;
01761 
01762 /*
01763  * Set up the 'byte output' routine
01764  */
01765 static void char_init(void)
01766 {
01767    a_count = 0;
01768 }
01769 
01770 /*
01771  * Define the storage for the packet accumulator
01772  */
01773 static char accum[256];
01774 
01775 /*
01776  * Add a character to the end of the current packet, and if it is 254
01777  * characters, flush the packet to disk.
01778  */
01779 static void char_out(int c)
01780 {
01781    accum[a_count++] = c;
01782    if (a_count >= 254)
01783       flush_char();
01784 }
01785 
01786 /*
01787  * Flush the packet to disk, and reset the accumulator
01788  */
01789 static void flush_char(void)
01790 {
01791    if (a_count > 0) {
01792       bputc(a_count, g_outbuffer);
01793       memcpy(g_outbuffer->data + g_outbuffer->size, accum, a_count);
01794       g_outbuffer->size += a_count;
01795       a_count = 0;
01796    }
01797 }
01798 
01799 static void init_statics(void)
01800 {
01801    /* Some of these are properly initialized later. What I'm doing
01802       here is making sure code that depends on C's initialization
01803       of statics doesn't break when the code gets called more
01804       than once. */
01805    Width = 0;
01806    Height = 0;
01807    curx = 0;
01808    cury = 0;
01809    CountDown = 0;
01810    Pass = 0;
01811    Interlace = 0;
01812    a_count = 0;
01813    cur_accum = 0;
01814    cur_bits = 0;
01815    g_init_bits = 0;
01816    g_outbuffer = 0;
01817    ClearCode = 0;
01818    EOFCode = 0;
01819    free_ent = 0;
01820    clear_flg = 0;
01821    offset = 0;
01822    in_count = 1;
01823    out_count = 0;
01824    hsize = HSIZE;
01825    n_bits = 0;
01826    maxbits = GIFBITS;
01827    maxcode = 0;
01828    maxmaxcode = (code_int) 1 << GIFBITS;
01829 }

01841 
01842 
01843 #define        MAXCOLORMAPSIZE         256
01844 
01845 #define        TRUE    1
01846 #define        FALSE   0
01847 
01848 #define CM_RED         0
01849 #define CM_GREEN       1
01850 #define CM_BLUE                2
01851 
01852 #define        MAX_LWZ_BITS            12
01853 
01854 #define INTERLACE              0x40
01855 #define LOCALCOLORMAP  0x80
01856 #define BitSet(byte, bit)      (((byte) & (bit)) == (bit))
01857 
01858 #define        ReadOK(file,buffer,len) (fread(buffer, len, 1, file) != 0)
01859 
01860 #define LM_to_uint(a,b)                        (((b)<<8)|(a))
01861 
01862 /* We may eventually want to use this information, but def it out for now */
01863 #if 0
01864 static struct {
01865    unsigned int Width;
01866    unsigned int Height;
01867    unsigned char ColorMap[3][MAXCOLORMAPSIZE];
01868    unsigned int BitPixel;
01869    unsigned int ColorResolution;
01870    unsigned int Background;
01871    unsigned int AspectRatio;
01872 } GifScreen;
01873 #endif
01874 
01875 static struct {
01876    int transparent;
01877    int delayTime;
01878    int inputFlag;
01879    int disposal;
01880 } Gif89 = {
01881 -1, -1, -1, 0};
01882 
01883 static int ReadColorMap(FILE * fd, int number, unsigned char (*buffer)[256]);
01884 static int DoExtension(FILE * fd, int label, int *Transparent);
01885 static int GetDataBlock(FILE * fd, unsigned char *buf);
01886 static int GetCode(FILE * fd, int code_size, int flag);
01887 static int LWZReadByte(FILE * fd, int flag, int input_code_size);
01888 static void ReadImage(gdImagePtr im, FILE * fd, int len, int height,
01889                       unsigned char (*cmap)[256], int interlace, int ignore);
01890 
01891 int ZeroDataBlock;
01892 
01893 gdImagePtr gdImageCreateFromGif(FILE * fd)
01894 {
01895    int imageNumber;
01896    int BitPixel;
01897    int ColorResolution;
01898    int Background;
01899    int AspectRatio;
01900    int Transparent = (-1);
01901    unsigned char buf[16];
01902    unsigned char c;
01903    unsigned char ColorMap[3][MAXCOLORMAPSIZE];
01904    unsigned char localColorMap[3][MAXCOLORMAPSIZE];
01905    int imw, imh;
01906    int useGlobalColormap;
01907    int bitPixel;
01908    int imageCount = 0;
01909    char version[4];
01910    gdImagePtr im = 0;
01911    ZeroDataBlock = FALSE;
01912 
01913    imageNumber = 1;
01914    if (!ReadOK(fd, buf, 6)) {
01915       return 0;
01916    }
01917    if (strncmp((char *) buf, "GIF", 3) != 0) {
01918       return 0;
01919    }
01920    strncpy(version, (char *) buf + 3, 3);
01921    version[3] = '\0';
01922 
01923    if ((strcmp(version, "87a") != 0) && (strcmp(version, "89a") != 0)) {
01924       return 0;
01925    }
01926    if (!ReadOK(fd, buf, 7)) {
01927       return 0;
01928    }
01929    BitPixel = 2 << (buf[4] & 0x07);
01930    ColorResolution = (int) (((buf[4] & 0x70) >> 3) + 1);
01931    Background = buf[5];
01932    AspectRatio = buf[6];
01933 
01934    if (BitSet(buf[4], LOCALCOLORMAP)) { /* Global Colormap */
01935       if (ReadColorMap(fd, BitPixel, ColorMap)) {
01936          return 0;
01937       }
01938    }
01939    for (;;) {
01940       if (!ReadOK(fd, &c, 1)) {
01941          return 0;
01942       }
01943       if (c == ';') {           /* GIF terminator */
01944          int i;
01945          if (imageCount < imageNumber) {
01946             return 0;
01947          }
01948          /* Terminator before any image was declared! */
01949          if (!im) {
01950             return 0;
01951          }
01952          /* Check for open colors at the end, so
01953             we can reduce colorsTotal and ultimately
01954             BitsPerPixel */
01955          for (i = ((im->colorsTotal - 1)); (i >= 0); i--) {
01956             if (im->open[i]) {
01957                im->colorsTotal--;
01958             } else {
01959                break;
01960             }
01961          }
01962          return im;
01963       }
01964 
01965       if (c == '!') {           /* Extension */
01966          if (!ReadOK(fd, &c, 1)) {
01967             return 0;
01968          }
01969          DoExtension(fd, c, &Transparent);
01970          continue;
01971       }
01972 
01973       if (c != ',') {           /* Not a valid start character */
01974          continue;
01975       }
01976 
01977       ++imageCount;
01978 
01979       if (!ReadOK(fd, buf, 9)) {
01980          return 0;
01981       }
01982 
01983       useGlobalColormap = !BitSet(buf[8], LOCALCOLORMAP);
01984 
01985       bitPixel = 1 << ((buf[8] & 0x07) + 1);
01986 
01987       imw = LM_to_uint(buf[4], buf[5]);
01988       imh = LM_to_uint(buf[6], buf[7]);
01989       if (!(im = gdImageCreate(imw, imh))) {
01990          return 0;
01991       }
01992       im->interlace = BitSet(buf[8], INTERLACE);
01993       if (!useGlobalColormap) {
01994          if (ReadColorMap(fd, bitPixel, localColorMap)) {
01995             return 0;
01996          }
01997          ReadImage(im, fd, imw, imh, localColorMap,
01998                    BitSet(buf[8], INTERLACE), imageCount != imageNumber);
01999       } else {
02000          ReadImage(im, fd, imw, imh,
02001                    ColorMap, BitSet(buf[8], INTERLACE), imageCount != imageNumber);
02002       }
02003       if (Transparent != (-1)) {
02004          gdImageColorTransparent(im, Transparent);
02005       }
02006    }
02007 }
02008 
02009 static int ReadColorMap(FILE * fd, int number, unsigned char (*buffer)[256])
02010 {
02011    int i;
02012    unsigned char rgb[3];
02013 
02014 
02015    for (i = 0; i < number; ++i) {
02016       if (!ReadOK(fd, rgb, sizeof(rgb))) {
02017          return TRUE;
02018       }
02019       buffer[CM_RED][i] = rgb[0];
02020       buffer[CM_GREEN][i] = rgb[1];
02021       buffer[CM_BLUE][i] = rgb[2];
02022    }
02023 
02024 
02025    return FALSE;
02026 }
02027 
02028 static int DoExtension(FILE * fd, int label, int *Transparent)
02029 {
02030    static unsigned char buf[256];
02031 
02032    switch (label) {
02033    case 0xf9:                  /* Graphic Control Extension */
02034       (void) GetDataBlock(fd, (unsigned char *) buf);
02035       Gif89.disposal = (buf[0] >> 2) & 0x7;
02036       Gif89.inputFlag = (buf[0] >> 1) & 0x1;
02037       Gif89.delayTime = LM_to_uint(buf[1], buf[2]);
02038       if ((buf[0] & 0x1) != 0)
02039          *Transparent = buf[3];
02040 
02041       while (GetDataBlock(fd, (unsigned char *) buf) != 0);
02042       return FALSE;
02043    default:
02044       break;
02045    }
02046    while (GetDataBlock(fd, (unsigned char *) buf) != 0);
02047 
02048    return FALSE;
02049 }
02050 
02051 static int GetDataBlock(FILE * fd, unsigned char *buf)
02052 {
02053    unsigned char count;
02054 
02055    if (!ReadOK(fd, &count, 1)) {
02056       return -1;
02057    }
02058 
02059    ZeroDataBlock = count == 0;
02060 
02061    if ((count != 0) && (!ReadOK(fd, buf, count))) {
02062       return -1;
02063    }
02064 
02065    return count;
02066 }
02067 
02068 static int GetCode(FILE * fd, int code_size, int flag)
02069 {
02070    static unsigned char buf[280];
02071    static int curbit, lastbit, done, last_byte;
02072    int i, j, ret;
02073    unsigned char count;
02074 
02075    if (flag) {
02076       curbit = 0;
02077       lastbit = 0;
02078       done = FALSE;
02079       return 0;
02080    }
02081 
02082    if ((curbit + code_size) >= lastbit) {
02083       if (done) {
02084          if (curbit >= lastbit) {
02085             /* Oh well */
02086          }
02087          return -1;
02088       }
02089       buf[0] = buf[last_byte - 2];
02090       buf[1] = buf[last_byte - 1];
02091 
02092       if ((count = GetDataBlock(fd, &buf[2])) == 0)
02093          done = TRUE;
02094 
02095       last_byte = 2 + count;
02096       curbit = (curbit - lastbit) + 16;
02097       lastbit = (2 + count) * 8;
02098    }
02099 
02100    ret = 0;
02101    for (i = curbit, j = 0; j < code_size; ++i, ++j)
02102       ret |= ((buf[i / 8] & (1 << (i % 8))) != 0) << j;
02103 
02104    curbit += code_size;
02105 
02106    return ret;
02107 }
02108 
02109 static int LWZReadByte(FILE * fd, int flag, int input_code_size)
02110 {
02111    static int fresh = FALSE;
02112    int code, incode;
02113    static int code_size, set_code_size;
02114    static int max_code, max_code_size;
02115    static int firstcode, oldcode;
02116    static int clear_code, end_code;
02117    static int table[2][(1 << MAX_LWZ_BITS)];
02118    static int stack[(1 << (MAX_LWZ_BITS)) * 2], *sp;
02119    register int i;
02120 
02121    if (flag) {
02122       set_code_size = input_code_size;
02123       code_size = set_code_size + 1;
02124       clear_code = 1 << set_code_size;
02125       end_code = clear_code + 1;
02126       max_code_size = 2 * clear_code;
02127       max_code = clear_code + 2;
02128 
02129       GetCode(fd, 0, TRUE);
02130 
02131       fresh = TRUE;
02132 
02133       for (i = 0; i < clear_code; ++i) {
02134          table[0][i] = 0;
02135          table[1][i] = i;
02136       }
02137       for (; i < (1 << MAX_LWZ_BITS); ++i)
02138          table[0][i] = table[1][0] = 0;
02139 
02140       sp = stack;
02141 
02142       return 0;
02143    } else if (fresh) {
02144       fresh = FALSE;
02145       do {
02146          firstcode = oldcode = GetCode(fd, code_size, FALSE);
02147       } while (firstcode == clear_code);
02148       return firstcode;
02149    }
02150 
02151    if (sp > stack)
02152       return *--sp;
02153 
02154    while ((code = GetCode(fd, code_size, FALSE)) >= 0) {
02155       if (code == clear_code) {
02156          for (i = 0; i < clear_code; ++i) {
02157             table[0][i] = 0;
02158             table[1][i] = i;
02159          }
02160          for (; i < (1 << MAX_LWZ_BITS); ++i)
02161             table[0][i] = table[1][i] = 0;
02162          code_size = set_code_size + 1;
02163          max_code_size = 2 * clear_code;
02164          max_code = clear_code + 2;
02165          sp = stack;
02166          firstcode = oldcode = GetCode(fd, code_size, FALSE);
02167          return firstcode;
02168       } else if (code == end_code) {
02169          int count;
02170          unsigned char buf[260];
02171 
02172          if (ZeroDataBlock)
02173             return -2;
02174 
02175          while ((count = GetDataBlock(fd, buf)) > 0);
02176 
02177          if (count != 0)
02178             return -2;
02179       }
02180 
02181       incode = code;
02182 
02183       if (code >= max_code) {
02184          *sp++ = firstcode;
02185          code = oldcode;
02186       }
02187 
02188       while (code >= clear_code) {
02189          *sp++ = table[1][code];
02190          if (code == table[0][code]) {
02191             /* Oh well */
02192          }
02193          code = table[0][code];
02194       }
02195 
02196       *sp++ = firstcode = table[1][code];
02197 
02198       if ((code = max_code) < (1 << MAX_LWZ_BITS)) {
02199          table[0][code] = oldcode;
02200          table[1][code] = firstcode;
02201          ++max_code;
02202          if ((max_code >= max_code_size) && (max_code_size < (1 << MAX_LWZ_BITS))) {
02203             max_code_size *= 2;
02204             ++code_size;
02205          }
02206       }
02207 
02208       oldcode = incode;
02209 
02210       if (sp > stack)
02211          return *--sp;
02212    }
02213    return code;
02214 }
02215 
02216 static void
02217 ReadImage(gdImagePtr im, FILE * fd, int len, int height, unsigned char (*cmap)[256],
02218           int interlace, int ignore)
02219 {
02220    unsigned char c;
02221    int v;
02222    int xpos = 0, ypos = 0, pass = 0;
02223    int i;
02224    /* Stash the color map into the image */
02225    for (i = 0; (i < gdMaxColors); i++) {
02226       im->red[i] = cmap[CM_RED][i];
02227       im->green[i] = cmap[CM_GREEN][i];
02228       im->blue[i] = cmap[CM_BLUE][i];
02229       im->open[i] = 1;
02230    }
02231    /* Many (perhaps most) of these colors will remain marked open. */
02232    im->colorsTotal = gdMaxColors;
02233    /*
02234     **  Initialize the Compression routines
02235     */
02236    if (!ReadOK(fd, &c, 1)) {
02237       return;
02238    }
02239    if (LWZReadByte(fd, TRUE, c) < 0) {
02240       return;
02241    }
02242 
02243    /*
02244     **  If this is an "uninteresting picture" ignore it.
02245     */
02246    if (ignore) {
02247       while (LWZReadByte(fd, FALSE, c) >= 0);
02248       return;
02249    }
02250 
02251    while ((v = LWZReadByte(fd, FALSE, c)) >= 0) {
02252       /* This how we recognize which colors are actually used. */
02253       if (im->open[v]) {
02254          im->open[v] = 0;
02255       }
02256       gdImageSetPixel(im, xpos, ypos, v);
02257       ++xpos;
02258       if (xpos == len) {
02259          xpos = 0;
02260          if (interlace) {
02261             switch (pass) {
02262             case 0:
02263             case 1:
02264                ypos += 8;
02265                break;
02266             case 2:
02267                ypos += 4;
02268                break;
02269             case 3:
02270                ypos += 2;
02271                break;
02272             }
02273 
02274             if (ypos >= height) {
02275                ++pass;
02276                switch (pass) {
02277                case 1:
02278                   ypos = 4;
02279                   break;
02280                case 2:
02281                   ypos = 2;
02282                   break;
02283                case 3:
02284                   ypos = 1;
02285                   break;
02286                default:
02287                   goto fini;
02288                }
02289             }
02290          } else {
02291             ++ypos;
02292          }
02293       }
02294       if (ypos >= height)
02295          break;
02296    }
02297 
02298  fini:
02299    if (LWZReadByte(fd, FALSE, c) >= 0) {
02300       /* Ignore extra */
02301    }
02302 }
02303 
02304 void gdImageRectangle(gdImagePtr im, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, int color)
02305 {
02306    gdImageLine(im, x1, y1, x2, y1, color);
02307    gdImageLine(im, x1, y2, x2, y2, color);
02308    gdImageLine(im, x1, y1, x1, y2, color);
02309    gdImageLine(im, x2, y1, x2, y2, color);
02310 }
02311 
02312 void gdImageFilledRectangle(gdImagePtr im, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, int color)
02313 {
02314    int x, y;
02315    for (y = y1; (y <= y2); y++) {
02316       for (x = x1; (x <= x2); x++) {
02317          gdImageSetPixel(im, x, y, color);
02318       }
02319    }
02320 }
02321 
02322 void gdImageCopy(gdImagePtr dst, gdImagePtr src, int dstX, int dstY, int srcX, int srcY,
02323                  int w, int h)
02324 {
02325    int c;
02326    int x, y;
02327    int tox, toy;
02328    int i;
02329    int colorMap[gdMaxColors];
02330    for (i = 0; (i < gdMaxColors); i++) {
02331       colorMap[i] = (-1);
02332    }
02333    toy = dstY;
02334    for (y = srcY; (y < (srcY + h)); y++) {
02335       tox = dstX;
02336       for (x = srcX; (x < (srcX + w)); x++) {
02337          int nc;
02338          c = gdImageGetPixel(src, x, y);
02339          /* Added 7/24/95: support transparent copies */
02340          if (gdImageGetTransparent(src) == c) {
02341             tox++;
02342             continue;
02343          }
02344          /* Have we established a mapping for this color? */
02345          if (colorMap[c] == (-1)) {
02346             /* If it's the same image, mapping is trivial */
02347             if (dst == src) {
02348                nc = c;
02349             } else {
02350                /* First look for an exact match */
02351                nc = gdImageColorExact(dst, src->red[c], src->green[c], src->blue[c]);
02352             }
02353             if (nc == (-1)) {
02354                /* No, so try to allocate it */
02355                nc = gdImageColorAllocate(dst, src->red[c], src->green[c], src->blue[c]);
02356                /* If we're out of colors, go for the
02357                   closest color */
02358                if (nc == (-1)) {
02359                   nc = gdImageColorClosest(dst, src->red[c], src->green[c], src->blue[c]);
02360                }
02361             }
02362             colorMap[c] = nc;
02363          }
02364          gdImageSetPixel(dst, tox, toy, colorMap[c]);
02365          tox++;
02366       }
02367       toy++;
02368    }
02369 }
02370 
02371 void gdImageCopyResized(gdImagePtr dst, gdImagePtr src, int dstX, int dstY, int srcX,
02372                         int srcY, int dstW, int dstH, int srcW, int srcH)
02373 {
02374    int c;
02375    int x, y;
02376    int tox, toy;
02377    int ydest;
02378    int i;
02379    int colorMap[gdMaxColors];
02380    /* Stretch vectors */
02381    int *stx;
02382    int *sty;
02383    /* We only need to use floating point to determine the correct
02384       stretch vector for one line's worth. */
02385    double accum;
02386    stx = (int *) M_MALLOC(sizeof(int) * srcW);
02387    sty = (int *) M_MALLOC(sizeof(int) * srcH);
02388    accum = 0;
02389    for (i = 0; (i < srcW); i++) {
02390       int got;
02391       accum += (double) dstW / (double) srcW;
02392       got = (int) floor(accum);
02393       stx[i] = got;
02394       accum -= got;
02395    }
02396    accum = 0;
02397    for (i = 0; (i < srcH); i++) {
02398       int got;
02399       accum += (double) dstH / (double) srcH;
02400       got = (int) floor(accum);
02401       sty[i] = got;
02402       accum -= got;
02403    }
02404    for (i = 0; (i < gdMaxColors); i++) {
02405       colorMap[i] = (-1);
02406    }
02407    toy = dstY;
02408    for (y = srcY; (y < (srcY + srcH)); y++) {
02409       for (ydest = 0; (ydest < sty[y - srcY]); ydest++) {
02410          tox = dstX;
02411          for (x = srcX; (x < (srcX + srcW)); x++) {
02412             int nc;
02413             if (!stx[x - srcX]) {
02414                continue;
02415             }
02416             c = gdImageGetPixel(src, x, y);
02417             /* Added 7/24/95: support transparent copies */
02418             if (gdImageGetTransparent(src) == c) {
02419                tox += stx[x - srcX];
02420                continue;
02421             }
02422             /* Have we established a mapping for this color? */
02423             if (colorMap[c] == (-1)) {
02424                /* If it's the same image, mapping is trivial */
02425                if (dst == src) {
02426                   nc = c;
02427                } else {
02428                   /* First look for an exact match */
02429                   nc = gdImageColorExact(dst, src->red[c], src->green[c], src->blue[c]);
02430                }
02431                if (nc == (-1)) {
02432                   /* No, so try to allocate it */
02433                   nc = gdImageColorAllocate(dst,
02434                                             src->red[c], src->green[c], src->blue[c]);
02435                   /* If we're out of colors, go for the
02436                      closest color */
02437                   if (nc == (-1)) {
02438                      nc = gdImageColorClosest(dst,
02439                                               src->red[c], src->green[c], src->blue[c]);
02440                   }
02441                }
02442                colorMap[c] = nc;
02443             }
02444             for (i = 0; (i < stx[x - srcX]); i++) {
02445                gdImageSetPixel(dst, tox, toy, colorMap[c]);
02446                tox++;
02447             }
02448          }
02449          toy++;
02450       }
02451    }
02452    M_FREE(stx);
02453    M_FREE(sty);
02454 }
02455 
02456 void gdImagePolygon(gdImagePtr im, gdPointPtr p, int n, int c)
02457 {
02458    int i;
02459    int lx, ly;
02460    if (!n) {
02461       return;
02462    }
02463    lx = p->x;
02464    ly = p->y;
02465    gdImageLine(im, lx, ly, p[n - 1].x, p[n - 1].y, c);
02466    for (i = 1; (i < n); i++) {
02467       p++;
02468       gdImageLine(im, lx, ly, p->x, p->y, c);
02469       lx = p->x;
02470       ly = p->y;
02471    }
02472 }
02473 
02474 int gdCompareInt(const void *a, const void *b);
02475 
02476 void gdImageFilledPolygon(gdImagePtr im, gdPointPtr p, int n, int c)
02477 {
02478    int i;
02479    int y;
02480    int y1, y2;
02481    int ints;
02482    if (!n) {
02483       return;
02484    }
02485    if (!im->polyAllocated) {
02486       im->polyInts = (int *) M_MALLOC(sizeof(int) * n);
02487       im->polyAllocated = n;
02488    }
02489    if (im->polyAllocated < n) {
02490       while (im->polyAllocated < n) {
02491          im->polyAllocated *= 2;
02492       }
02493       im->polyInts = (int *) realloc(im->polyInts, sizeof(int) * im->polyAllocated);
02494    }
02495    y1 = p[0].y;
02496    y2 = p[0].y;
02497    for (i = 1; (i < n); i++) {
02498       if (p[i].y < y1) {
02499          y1 = p[i].y;
02500       }
02501       if (p[i].y > y2) {
02502          y2 = p[i].y;
02503       }
02504    }
02505    for (y = y1; (y <= y2); y++) {
02506       int interLast = 0;
02507       int dirLast = 0;
02508       int interFirst = 1;
02509       ints = 0;
02510       for (i = 0; (i <= n); i++) {
02511          int x1, x2;
02512          int y1, y2;
02513          int dir;
02514          int ind1, ind2;
02515          int lastInd1 = 0;
02516          if ((i == n) || (!i)) {
02517             ind1 = n - 1;
02518             ind2 = 0;
02519          } else {
02520             ind1 = i - 1;
02521             ind2 = i;
02522          }
02523          y1 = p[ind1].y;
02524          y2 = p[ind2].y;
02525          if (y1 < y2) {
02526             y1 = p[ind1].y;
02527             y2 = p[ind2].y;
02528             x1 = p[ind1].x;
02529             x2 = p[ind2].x;
02530             dir = -1;
02531          } else if (y1 > y2) {
02532             y2 = p[ind1].y;
02533             y1 = p[ind2].y;
02534             x2 = p[ind1].x;
02535             x1 = p[ind2].x;
02536             dir = 1;
02537          } else {
02538             /* Horizontal; just draw it */
02539             gdImageLine(im, p[ind1].x, y1, p[ind2].x, y1, c);
02540             continue;
02541          }
02542          if ((y >= y1) && (y <= y2)) {
02543             int inter = (y - y1) * (x2 - x1) / (y2 - y1) + x1;
02544             /* Only count intersections once
02545                except at maxima and minima. Also, 
02546                if two consecutive intersections are
02547                endpoints of the same horizontal line
02548                that is not at a maxima or minima,   
02549                discard the leftmost of the two. */
02550             if (!interFirst) {
02551                if ((p[ind1].y == p[lastInd1].y) && (p[ind1].x != p[lastInd1].x)) {
02552                   if (dir == dirLast) {
02553                      if (inter > interLast) {
02554                         /* Replace the old one */
02555                         im->polyInts[ints] = inter;
02556                      } else {
02557                         /* Discard this one */
02558                      }
02559                      continue;
02560                   }
02561                }
02562                if (inter == interLast) {
02563                   if (dir == dirLast) {
02564                      continue;
02565                   }
02566                }
02567             }
02568             if (i > 0) {
02569                im->polyInts[ints++] = inter;
02570             }
02571             lastInd1 = i;
02572             dirLast = dir;
02573             interLast = inter;
02574             interFirst = 0;
02575          }
02576       }
02577       qsort(im->polyInts, ints, sizeof(int), gdCompareInt);
02578       for (i = 0; (i < (ints - 1)); i += 2) {
02579          gdImageLine(im, im->polyInts[i], y, im->polyInts[i + 1], y, c);
02580       }
02581    }
02582 }
02583 
02584 int gdCompareInt(const void *a, const void *b)
02585 {
02586    return (*(const int *) a) - (*(const int *) b);
02587 }
02588 
02589 void gdImageSetStyle(gdImagePtr im, int *style, int noOfPixels)
02590 {
02591    if (im->style) {
02592       M_FREE(im->style);
02593    }
02594    im->style = (int *)
02595        M_MALLOC(sizeof(int) * noOfPixels);
02596    memcpy(im->style, style, sizeof(int) * noOfPixels);
02597    im->styleLength = noOfPixels;
02598    im->stylePos = 0;
02599 }
02600 
02601 void gdImageSetBrush(gdImagePtr im, gdImagePtr brush)
02602 {
02603    int i;
02604    im->brush = brush;
02605    for (i = 0; (i < gdImageColorsTotal(brush)); i++) {
02606       int index;
02607       index = gdImageColorExact(im,
02608                                 gdImageRed(brush, i),
02609                                 gdImageGreen(brush, i), gdImageBlue(brush, i));
02610       if (index == (-1)) {
02611          index = gdImageColorAllocate(im,
02612                                       gdImageRed(brush, i),
02613                                       gdImageGreen(brush, i), gdImageBlue(brush, i));
02614          if (index == (-1)) {
02615             index = gdImageColorClosest(im,
02616                                         gdImageRed(brush, i),
02617                                         gdImageGreen(brush, i), gdImageBlue(brush, i));
02618          }
02619       }
02620       im->brushColorMap[i] = index;
02621    }
02622 }

02624 void gdImageInterlace(gdImagePtr im, int interlaceArg)
02625 {
02626    im->interlace = interlaceArg;
02627 }
